django.db.backends.mysql.introspection
======================================

.. py:module:: django.db.backends.mysql.introspection

----------

.. autoapisummary::

   django.db.backends.mysql.introspection.FieldInfo
   django.db.backends.mysql.introspection.TableInfo

.. autoapisummary::

   django.db.backends.mysql.introspection.InfoLine

---------------

.. py:data:: FieldInfo

.. py:class:: InfoLine

   Bases: :py:obj:`tuple`


   .. py:attribute:: col_name


   .. py:attribute:: data_type


   .. py:attribute:: max_len


   .. py:attribute:: num_prec

.. py:data:: TableInfo

.. py:class:: DatabaseIntrospection

   Bases: :py:obj:`django.db.backends.base.introspection.BaseDatabaseIntrospection`


   .. py:attribute:: data_types_reverse


   .. py:method:: get_field_type(data_type, description)


   .. py:method:: get_table_list(cursor)

      Return a list of table and view names in the current database.



   .. py:method:: get_table_description(cursor, table_name)

      Return a description of the table with the DB-API cursor.description
      interface."



   .. py:method:: get_sequences(cursor, table_name, table_fields=())


   .. py:method:: get_relations(cursor, table_name)

      Return a dictionary of {field_name: (field_name_other_table, other_table)}
      representing all foreign keys in the given table.



   .. py:method:: get_storage_engine(cursor, table_name)

      Retrieve the storage engine for a given table. Return the default
      storage engine if the table doesn't exist.



   .. py:method:: get_constraints(cursor, table_name)

      Retrieve any constraints or keys (unique, pk, fk, check, index) across
      one or more columns.
